body:
Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB)‘s stock had its “outperform” rating reissued by equities researchers at RBC Capital Markets in a research report issued on Tuesday. They presently have a $170.00 price target on the social networking company’s stock. RBC Capital Markets’ target price suggests a potential upside of 30.45% from the stock’s previous close.

Several other research firms also recently issued reports on FB. Robert W. Baird reaffirmed an “outperform” rating and set a $155.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Tuesday, October 4th. Canaccord Genuity reaffirmed a “buy” rating and set a $160.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Tuesday, October 4th. Mizuho reaffirmed a “buy” rating and set a $150.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Tuesday, October 4th. Wedbush reaffirmed an “outperform” rating and set a $162.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Wednesday, October 5th. Finally, Piper Jaffray Companies reaffirmed an “overweight” rating and set a $185.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Wednesday, October 5th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, six have issued a hold rating, forty-four have issued a buy rating and three have given a strong buy rating to the company’s stock. The stock currently has a consensus rating of “Buy” and a consensus price target of $149.89.

Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) traded down 0.50% during mid-day trading on Tuesday, hitting $130.32. 19,790,484 shares of the stock were exchanged. The stock has a market cap of $375.60 billion, a PE ratio of 50.24 and a beta of 0.67. Facebook has a 52-week low of $96.82 and a 52-week high of $133.50. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $123.50 and its 200 day moving average is $124.48.

In other Facebook news, insider Christopher K. Cox sold 16,000 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Friday, January 20th. The stock was sold at an average price of $128.16, for a total value of $2,050,560.00. Following the sale, the insider now directly owns 169,938 shares in the company, valued at $21,779,254.08. The transaction was disclosed in a document filed with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this link. Also, VP Colin Stretch sold 750 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction on Tuesday, January 24th. The shares were sold at an average price of $129.47, for a total value of $97,102.50. Following the completion of the sale, the vice president now owns 76,209 shares in the company, valued at $9,866,779.23. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. Insiders sold 5,175,264 shares of company stock worth $618,442,479 over the last quarter. 19.08% of the stock is currently owned by company insiders.

Several hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the stock. Vanguard Group Inc. raised its position in shares of Facebook by 2.5% in the second quarter. Vanguard Group Inc. now owns 139,483,685 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $15,940,195,000 after buying an additional 3,400,653 shares during the period. Price T Rowe Associates Inc. MD raised its position in shares of Facebook by 3.4% in the third quarter. Price T Rowe Associates Inc. MD now owns 73,723,960 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $9,456,572,000 after buying an additional 2,402,049 shares during the period. BlackRock Institutional Trust Company N.A. raised its position in shares of Facebook by 2.8% in the third quarter. BlackRock Institutional Trust Company N.A. now owns 61,107,258 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $7,838,228,000 after buying an additional 1,659,217 shares during the period. Capital World Investors raised its position in shares of Facebook by 2.8% in the third quarter. Capital World Investors now owns 34,067,024 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $4,369,777,000 after buying an additional 935,732 shares during the period. Finally, BlackRock Fund Advisors raised its position in shares of Facebook by 3.7% in the third quarter. BlackRock Fund Advisors now owns 30,413,666 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $3,901,161,000 after buying an additional 1,092,664 shares during the period. 57.28% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors.

Facebook, Inc builds products that enable people to connect and share through mobile devices and personal computers. The Company enables people to share their opinions, ideas, photos and videos, and other activities. Its products include Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp and Oculus. Facebook is a mobile application and Website that enables people to connect, share, discover and communicate with each other on mobile devices and personal computers.

title: Facebook’s (FB) Outperform Rating Reiterated at RBC Capital Markets
